description.narrative: The Sida funded programme will support the Council of Europe's (CoEs) country Action Plans in the Easter Partnership (EaP) region, i.e. Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, Moldova and Ukraine with a total suggested budget of 75 MSEK during the period 2019-2023. These Action Plans are strategic instruments which aim, through co-operation, to accompany countries in their efforts to bring legislation, institutions and practice further into line with European standards in the areas of human rights, the rule of law and democracy thus supporting countries in meeting their obligations. The intermediate outcomes expected are: 1. Eastern Partnership countries legislation, institutions and practices were further brought in line with European standards in the areas of human rights, rule of law and democracy. 2. Armenia, Azerbaijan, Georgia, Republic of Moldova and Ukraine made further progress in meeting their obligations as Council of Europe member states. Immediate outcomes: 1.1 Human rights: Human rights protection and equality are enhanced through the well-structured and coordinated implementation of human rights standards, including those on gender equality, and an improved effectiveness of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) system. 2.1 Rule of law: Democratic security is strengthened by an enhanced implementation of the existing legislation and European standards, the development of an enabling legal and institutional framework for a democratic and an improved quality of justice and efficiency in combating corruption. 3.1 Democracy: The democratisation of society is fostered through electoral integrity, strengthened local democracy and increased participation of young people in the democratic process. The focus of the Action Plans is to support: the revision of legislative and institutional frameworks in line with the CoE standards; the efficient functioning of reformed and newly established democratic institutions contributing to the implementation of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) and of other Council of Europe standards.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
